claims.claim: Digital twins significantly reduce quality issues and shorten design and production lead times
claims.quote: For example, on the A320 family "heads of versions" – the first aircraft in a series with identical specifications for a given customer – the use of 3D data as a master and automation is significantly reducing quality issues and shortening design and production lead times.

claims.claim: Digital twins accelerate time to market and enhance design accuracy by reducing need for physical prototypes
claims.quote: They enable our engineering teams to simulate aircraft behaviour under a multitude of real-world scenarios, using physics-based models. This capability significantly reduces the need for physical prototypes, accelerating time to market and enhancing design accuracy and performance validation.

claims.claim: Digital twins boost manufacturing efficiency and minimize paperwork
claims.quote: By simulating tools, robots, workflows, and supply chains, we can predict how designs will perform under various conditions, boosting efficiency and minimising paperwork.

claims.claim: Over 12,000 aircraft are connected to digital twin platform providing real-time insights
claims.quote: Today, over 12,000 aircraft are connected to the Skywise platform, where real-time data from sensors throughout the aircraft feeds their virtual twins.

claims.claim: Airbus produces more than 25,000 flight-ready 3D-printed parts annually to address supply chain constraints
claims.quote: Airbus is now addressing supply chain constraints by producing more than 25,000 flight-ready 3D-printed parts annually.

claims.claim: Over 200,000 certified 3D-printed polymer parts are in active service worldwide
claims.quote: It now has over 200,000 certified Stratasys polymer parts in active service with airlines and air forces worldwide.

claims.claim: 3D printed parts resulted in 43% weight reduction on A350 aircraft
claims.quote: Stratasys shares that the implementation of' 3D printed parts in the production process of the Airbus A350 long-haul jet has resulted in a 43% weight reduction.

claims.claim: 3D printing eliminated minimum order quantity requirements and achieved 85% reduction in lead time
claims.quote: For Airbus, this process eliminated the Minimum Order Quantity (MOQ) requirement, and led to an 85% reduction in lead time.

claims.claim: AI-powered computer vision accelerated inspections from hundreds to millions of images per minute
claims.quote: By combining this direction with the custom annotation tool, we were able to accelerate inspections from hundreds of images per minute to millions of images per minute.

claims.claim: AI automation eliminates human error and dramatically improves accuracy leading to significant manufacturing savings
claims.quote: The result is a dramatic improvement in the accuracy of the readings which translates into significant savings during the manufacturing process — all while boosting quality and maintaining safety standards.

claims.claim: Atlas AI's GeoAI platform demonstrated ability to develop better bottom-up forecasts reflecting dynamic growth profiles
claims.quote: In the initial deployment phase of the collaboration, Atlas AI's technology demonstrated an ability to develop bottom-up forecasts that better reflect the dynamic and heterogeneous growth profile of the initial markets being tested.

claims.claim: GeoAI provides unprecedented granularity and adaptability in forecasting to improve market understanding
claims.quote: The team's level of granularity and adaptability in forecasting could significantly improve Airbus' understanding of rapidly evolving markets, aiding in better anticipating future air travel demands and trends.
